question: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $1,000?
true_answer: With an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $1,000, you can afford a home loan around $320,000.

steps.content: What is the maximum home loan I can afford with an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $1,000?
Plan: 1) Pass to home_loan_agent for affordability calculation. 2) Validate debts with credit_agent. 3) Use calculator for detailed calculation. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on loan affordability calculation based on income and debts.
Loan affordability generally uses a 28% front-end and 36% back-end DTI ratio.
Confirmed monthly debts: $1,000. Proceed with calculation.
Calculating maximum loan based on $80,000 income and $1,000 debts.
Maximum monthly mortgage payment: $1,867. Maximum loan: approximately $320,000.
Does this include property taxes and insurance?
Retrieving knowledge on additional costs like property taxes and insurance.
Estimates usually exclude taxes and insurance. Consider these for final affordability.
Review complete, calculations verified. All criteria met.
With an annual income of $80,000 and monthly debts of $1,000, you can afford a home loan around $320,000. Be mindful of additional costs like taxes and insurance.
